org.helianto.core.security
Class UserAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.helianto.core.security.AbstractUserDetails
      org.helianto.core.security.UserAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, org.acegisecurity.userdetails.UserDetails, PublicUserDetails
public final class UserAdapter
extends AbstractUserDetails
implements java.io.Serializable, PublicUserDetails

Models core user information retieved by an UserDetailsService as an adapter class to keep coupling from the Acegi-security package as narrow as possible.

A new UserAdapter must be built from a single Credential. As such Credential may be connected to zero or more Users, the authorities granted are exposed only after at least one corresponding User is selected as current. This is is a design choice made to allow multiple entities to share the same set of credentials and still keep individual sets of authorities.

To avoid further processing after authentication for environments where all credentials can be restricted to a single entity, i.e. one User per Credential, the constructor silently tries to do the selection.

Service layer code should retrieve UserAdapter through the PublicUserDetails interface to prevent unintended access to the embedded User and Credential instances. A convenient static method retrievePublicUserDetailsFromSecurityContext() is supplied to perform this task. PublicUserDetails provides a method to set the current User after any Entity selection.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
Mauricio Fernandes de Castro
See Also:
